titles.title: Fuel Economy Truth in Labeling Act
A bill to require accurate fuel economy testing procedures.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

bill.summary: 4/18/2005--Introduced. Fuel Economy Truth in Labeling Act - Directs the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to initiate a rulemaking to revise certain Federal vehicle fuel economy test procedures to take into consideration current factors that may affect vehicle fuel economy, including higher speed limits, faster acceleration rates, variations in temperature, use of air conditioning, shorter city test cycle lengths, and the use of other fuel depleting features.
